text: hi everyone today I will make a
Vietnamese Korean fusion dish with my
best friend Natalie we are making
bulgogi fresh spring rolls let's begin
you will need a medium size ripe pear
about 250 gram peel and cut into pieces
also chop a small onion into small
pieces in a food processor combine a
chop an onion and 6 cloves of garlic
then fold to puree transfer to a bowl
add 4 tbsp of soy sauce 2 tbsp sugar and
stir well to dissolve next slide 500
gram beef into very thin slices make
sure you slide against the grain so that
it will be tender then add to the
marinade I also add a teaspoon of honey
and some black pepper
set aside to marinate for about 30
minutes for any kaiser vietname fresh
pink rose we always need fresh herbs so
Natalie is helping me picking up some
fresh mint cilantro and some radish
sprouts that I plant in my bank oniy
then she rings did a few time and green
she also sliced cucumbers and different
kinds of peppers into thin strips for
the sauce we will need Korean hot pepper
paste peanut butter honey and michaud
paste in a pan on medium heat add a
tablespoon of vegetable oil and fry a
teaspoon of minced garlic until fragrant
then add hot pepper paste peanut butter
honey and Mitchell about a tablespoon
each then add a quarter cup of water and
stir well to dissolve simmer on low heat
until the sauce is slightly thickened
you can either grill the beef or cook it
in a pan with some sesame oil just cook
thin layer of peace at a time when one
side is no longer pink turn it over and
cook the other side until done it should
take just about one to two minutes and
do not overcook the beef but just from
the pair will make the beef tender and
juicy
then place the beef on a plate set up a
rolling station with a plate of dry
flashable slide letters and herv's a
tray up warm water the beef and the
colorful ullians vegetables Janish the
sauce with some crusty nuts and fried
shallots to roll quickly dip the rice
paper into the warm water to soften tap
it up with lettuce and fresh herbs a few
strips of cucumber carrots spring onion
and the colorful peppers unsought top up
with the beef and of course kimchi lift
up one side of the rice paper and stop
rolling until you reach the center then
fold both sides inward and continue to
roll up until the end for a nice
presentation you can slide the roll in
half on the diagonal and serve them on a
plate with a small bowl of sauce in the
middle to serve to dip the ROE in the
sauce and enjoy I hope you like it and
thank you for watching bye bye
